alert.note: Alert for Dallas; Lowndes (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 1:14PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lowndes and southeastern Dallas Counties through 145 PM CST... At 114 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dallas Lake, or 12 miles south of Selmont-West Selmont, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mosses, Hayneville, White Hall, Gordonville, Lowndesboro, Benton, Dallas Lake, Belknap, Dannelly Reservoir and Collirene. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for central and south central Alabama.
